web_interface.automatic_detection_desc: When you add a repository for a specific operating system (e.g., Ubuntu 24.04), SysManage automatically:
web_interface.detection_feature1: Identifies all hosts running that OS version
web_interface.detection_feature2: Sends repository configuration to matching agents
web_interface.step1: Navigate to Settings â†’ Third-Party Repositories
web_interface.step2: Select the target operating system from the dropdown
web_interface.step3: Enter the repository configuration (format varies by OS)
web_interface.step4: Optionally provide GPG key URL or content (for Linux systems)
web_interface.step5: Review the configuration in the preview pane
web_interface.step6: Click "Add Repository" to apply to all compatible hosts
web_interface.title: Using the Web Interface

organizational.approval_workflow_desc: Require manager approval before adding repositories
organizational.documentation_desc: Maintain a registry of approved repositories and their purposes
organizational.periodic_review_desc: Quarterly reviews of all third-party repositories
organizational.testing_procedure_desc: Establish testing protocols for new repositories
organizational.title: Organizational Best Practices
organizational.version_control_desc: Track repository configurations in version control systems

technical.backup_keys_desc: Maintain offline backups of GPG keys
technical.mirror_repos_desc: Host internal mirrors of critical third-party repositories
technical.monitor_changes_desc: Set up alerts for repository configuration changes
technical.pin_versions_desc: Use version-specific repository URLs where possible
technical.staged_rollout_desc: Deploy to dev â†’ test â†’ production environments sequentially
technical.title: Technical Best Practices

database.field_gpg_key_url: URL to GPG signing key (for verification)
database.title: Database Schema

removing.step1: Locate the repository in the list
removing.step3: Confirm the removal in the dialog
removing.step4: SysManage removes the configuration from all affected hosts
removing.step5: Package cache is updated on each host
removing.title: Removing Repositories

updating.description: To modify an existing repository configuration:
updating.note: SysManage currently does not support in-place editing of repository configurations to prevent accidental changes across the infrastructure.
updating.step2: Add the new configuration with updated settings
updating.title: Updating Repository Configurations

viewing.description: The Third-Party Repositories page displays all configured repositories organized by operating system:
viewing.host_count_desc: Number of hosts using this repository
viewing.metadata_desc: Added by user, timestamp, GPG key status
viewing.os_grouping_desc: Repositories grouped by target OS (Ubuntu 24.04, RHEL 9, etc.)
viewing.title: Viewing Configured Repositories

overview.description: SysManage provides centralized management of third-party package repositories across multiple operating systems. This feature allows administrators to add, configure, and manage additional software sources for all supported platforms except OpenBSD, which by design does not support third-party repositories.
overview.feature_automatic_detection_desc: OS-specific repository format and GPG key handling
overview.feature_centralized_desc: Manage repositories across entire fleet from single interface
overview.feature_cross_platform_desc: Manage repositories on Debian, Ubuntu, RHEL, CentOS, Fedora, SUSE, FreeBSD, NetBSD, Windows, and macOS
overview.feature_gpg_key_desc: Automated GPG key import and verification
overview.feature_user_attribution_desc: Track which administrator added each repository
overview.title: Overview

best_practices.document_purpose_desc: Maintain documentation of why each repository was added
best_practices.gpg_keys_desc: Always provide GPG keys for package verification on Linux systems
best_practices.https_desc: Use HTTPS repository URLs to prevent man-in-the-middle attacks
best_practices.test_first_desc: Test new repositories on non-production systems first
best_practices.title: Best Practices
best_practices.verify_sources_desc: Only add repositories from trusted, verified sources

compliance.approval_process: Establish formal approval processes for adding repositories
compliance.audit_trail: Maintain audit trails of repository additions and removals
compliance.description: When managing third-party repositories in regulated environments:
compliance.license_compliance: Verify license compliance for software from third-party sources
compliance.risk_assessment: Perform security risk assessments before adding new sources
compliance.title: Compliance Considerations
compliance.vendor_support: Document vendor support implications of third-party software

third_party_repositories.subtitle: Comprehensive guide to managing third-party package repositories across your infrastructure for Debian, Ubuntu, RHEL-based, SUSE-based, FreeBSD, NetBSD, Windows, and macOS systems.

openbsd.description: OpenBSD does not support third-party package repositories by design. The OpenBSD package system exclusively uses official release-specific repositories maintained by the OpenBSD project. This is a deliberate security and stability design decision by the OpenBSD team.
openbsd.title: OpenBSD - Not Supported

windows.authentication_desc: Supports username/password and API key authentication
windows.title: Windows (Chocolatey)

third_party_repositories.title: Third-Party Repository Management

diagnostic_commands.description: Run these commands on target hosts to diagnose repository issues:
diagnostic_commands.title: Diagnostic Commands

troubleshooting.gpg_key_import_failed_solution1: Verify GPG key URL is accessible from target hosts
troubleshooting.gpg_key_import_failed_solution2: Check network connectivity and firewall rules
troubleshooting.gpg_key_import_failed_solution3: Try providing GPG key content directly instead of URL
troubleshooting.gpg_key_import_failed_solution4: Verify key format is correct for the operating system
troubleshooting.hosts_not_receiving: Some Hosts Not Receiving Repository Configuration
troubleshooting.hosts_not_receiving_solution1: Verify hosts are online and connected to SysManage
troubleshooting.hosts_not_receiving_solution2: Check OS name and version match exactly
troubleshooting.hosts_not_receiving_solution3: Review WebSocket connection status for affected hosts
troubleshooting.hosts_not_receiving_solution4: Check for agent permission issues (root/administrator required)
troubleshooting.permission_denied_solution1: Ensure SysManage agent is running with elevated privileges
troubleshooting.permission_denied_solution2: Check file permissions on repository configuration directories
troubleshooting.permission_denied_solution3: Verify SELinux/AppArmor policies allow repository modifications
troubleshooting.repository_not_found_solution1: Verify repository URL is correct and accessible
troubleshooting.repository_not_found_solution2: Check OS version matches repository configuration
troubleshooting.repository_not_found_solution3: Ensure package cache was updated on target hosts
troubleshooting.repository_not_found_solution4: Review agent logs for error messages
troubleshooting.title: Troubleshooting

auto_discovery.description: SysManage ã‚¨ãƒ¼ã‚¸ã‚§ãƒ³ãƒˆ includes automatic server discovery that eliminates manual configuration:

openbsd_notes.security_note_text: The agent requires cryptography support for secure certificate-based authentication. Rust is mandatory for building these security packages. The run script automatically detects if Rust is available and uses appropriate installation methods.

distributed.description: UUIDs are globally unique, preventing ID conflicts in distributed systems and reducing attack surface in multi-tenant environments.
distributed.title: ğŸŒ Distributed ã‚·ã‚¹ãƒ†ãƒ  ã‚»ã‚­ãƒ¥ãƒªãƒ†ã‚£

enumeration.description: Sequential IDs (1, 2, 3...) allow attackers to easily enumerate resources. UUIDs eliminate this vulnerability by using non-predictable identifiers.
enumeration.title: ğŸ›¡ï¸ ID Enumeration Attack Prevention

gdpr.description: UUIDs support data anonymization requirements by providing identifiers that cannot be easily correlated across systems.
gdpr.title: ğŸ“‹ GDPR Compliance ã‚µãƒãƒ¼ãƒˆ
